SULHA is...
Arabic for RECONCILIATION
Hebrew for FORGIVENESS
The Sulha Peace Project is a grassroots organisation that believes in equality, gives everyone a voice and redefines the idea of hope for tolerance in the world between all cultures and religions...this is "the way to Sulha."
A new peace language has been developing throughout the years, since Sulha's first gathering in 2001. Its grassroots methodology is expressed through listening circles, multicultural workshops, family & teenage groups, interfaith rituals and celebration through the arts, all led by trained facilitators. It is a concept that is breaking boundaries and creating circles of unity that are growing each day as the word is spread...
For more information visit http://www.sulha.com/
If you live in Israel, Palestine, United States or Australia log on to find out about your local meetings... If you live elsewhere, find out how to start your own!
Remember:
"IF YOU WILL IT, IT IS NOT A DREAM." --Theodore Herzel
1. The way to peace is through rebuilding trust, restoring dignity and taking personal steps to ensure this - moving beyond the political agenda.
2. By people connecting as equal individuals, we can embrace our differences and learn to co-exist.
3. Coming together to share each other's culture is the path to Sulha... Through song, dance, learning and listening.
cause.mission: To build trust and restore dignity, from heart to heart and from village to village, moving beyond a specific political agenda, stereotypes, clichés, humiliation and despair.
